DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Fitzpatrick Classification Scale of skin type based on the skin complexion and the degree of tolerance to sun exposure and it relates to the amount of melanin pigment in the skin.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A classification system used by dermatologists to determine a person's risk for sunburn. The classification is based on the skin complexion and the degree of tolerance to sun exposure and it relates to the amount of melanin pigment in the skin. It was developed by Dr. Thomas Fitzpatrick in 1975 to determine patient's skin reaction to laser and light therapy treatments. According to this system, there are six skin varieties classified from I to VI.:A distinctive characteristic of the skin marked by the amount of sebum secreted by sebaceous glands.

Property.preferredDefinition: A distinctive characteristic of the skin marked by the amount of sebum secreted by sebaceous glands.

Concepts.definition: A distinctive characteristic of the skin marked by the amount of sebum secreted by sebaceous glands.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A classification system used by dermatologists to determine a person's risk for sunburn. The classification is based on the skin complexion and the degree of tolerance to sun exposure and it relates to the amount of melanin pigment in the skin. It was developed by Dr. Thomas Fitzpatrick in 1975 to determine patient's skin reaction to laser and light therapy treatments. According to this system, there are six skin varieties classified from I to VI._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin which is extremely pale white and it always burns when exposed to the sun. It is seen in people with blond or red hair and blue or hazel eyes.

Concepts.definition: Skin which is extremely pale white and it always burns when exposed to the sun. It is seen in people with blond or red hair and blue or hazel eyes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin which is white and it usually burns easily when exposed to the sun. It is usually seen in people with blond or red hair and blue or hazel eyes.

Concepts.definition: Skin which is white and it usually burns easily when exposed to the sun. It is usually seen in people with blond or red hair and blue or hazel eyes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin which is light brown and it rarely burns when exposed to the sun. It is usually seen in people of Mediterranean origin.

Concepts.definition: Skin which is light brown and it rarely burns when exposed to the sun. It is usually seen in people of Mediterranean origin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin which is brown and it burns very rarely when exposed to the sun. It is usually seen in people of Middle Eastern origin.

Concepts.definition: Skin which is brown and it burns very rarely when exposed to the sun. It is usually seen in people of Middle Eastern origin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin which is dark brown or black and it never burns when exposed to the sun.

Concepts.definition: Skin which is dark brown or black and it never burns when exposed to the sun.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Skin which is darker white and it sometimes burns when exposed to the sun. This type of skin can be seen in people with any hair or eye color.

Concepts.definition: Skin which is darker white and it sometimes burns when exposed to the sun. This type of skin can be seen in people with any hair or eye color.
